newsitem.title: GREECE: Ecu/drachma softer, short-term forex forwards up.
newsitem.headline: Ecu/drachma softer, short-term forex forwards up.

text.p: Greek depos were ranging after exhibiting high volatility earlier on, short-term implied drachma rates from forex forwards were firmer and ecu/drachma was softer trading around 308.55/65 in late trade, dealers said.

"Depos were very volatile earlier on but the market has calmed down and depos range in late trade," a foreign bank forex dealer said. "Short-term implied drachma rates from forex forwards are firmer."
Bank of Greece drained 250 billion drachmas of 14-day funds at 11.90 percent in a depo tender on Wednesday.
Traders said the central bank wanted rate volatility but showed its intention not to let interest rates fall too much in order to support its hard drachma policy.
Ecu/drachma was trading around 308.55/65 in late trade. Ecu/drachma was set at 309 at the central bank's fixing where Bank of Greece bought about 40 million ecus at the fixing.
"There were some ecu sales after the fixing from London banks and light ecu buying in the afternoon," a forex trader said
The mark was quoted at 158.59/69 from Wednesday's 158.890 fix, the dollar at 265.05/15 drachmas from 265.600 and the ecu at 308.85/95 from 309.000 drachmas.
